author: ralexstokes
content:
so lets walk thru the process: 

a builder wants to build a block, it has already collected a preference from the target proposer to have a gas limit of G.
it assembles an execution block targeting a gas limit of G (keeping in mind it can shift some wrt the parent like your original post up above)
what is most likely to happen next is that the builder sends the full execution payload to the relay
the relay can validate every last detail of the execution block
it will select the most valuable one of these blocks it gets from the pool of connected builders and send this execution block to the proposer to sign when they ask with one important caveat: the transactions have been "blinded" by just sending the hash tree root of them
the proposer likely uses mev-boost to validate what it can locally (or just trust the relay on this) and will sign the "blinded" block
